SEARCH
Package client

Class MarketClient

java.lang.Object
client.MarketClient
public class MarketClient extends Object
This class represents the client in the context of a client-server communication. It allows the user to (indirectly) send and receive requests and responses to the server, like the authentication, lists of products, action status, etc...

  • Method Details

    • getServer

      public Socket getServer()
      Getter method for the field server, the socket connected to server's port.

    • getSocketOut

      public ObjectOutputStream getSocketOut()
      Getter method for the field socketOutput, the socket output stream.

    • getSocketIn

      public ObjectInputStream getSocketIn()
      Getter method for the field socketInput, the socket input stream.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Returns true if the client is connected to the server, false otherwise.

    • isAuthenticated

      public boolean isAuthenticated()
      Returns true if current user is authenticate, false otherwise.

    • getProducts

      public List<Product> getProducts(int code)
      Getter method to obtain a specific list of products. Based on code input parameter this method returns the list of products for sale, the list of products owned by the current user or an empty list.

    • checkCredentials

      public boolean checkCredentials(CredentialsCouple credentials)
      This method gets the credentials from login fields and sends them to server by a CredentialsCouple object. The response status then is returned: true for authentication, false otherwise.

    • startCommunication

      public boolean startCommunication(int code, String prod)
      This method simply sends a message via socket to the server and get the response. It allows 6 different requests: 0 - close application (no response needed) 1 - products for sale 2 - products owned by the current user 3 - buy a product (specified by an id) 4 - return a product (specified by an id) 5 - upload a product (string format)

    • close

      public void close()
      This method closes every object used to communicate with the server: ObjectInputStream - ObjectOutputStream - Socket
